default_fix: Replace the failed PSU module and verify power redundancy.
steps: Check chassis LEDs and management interface for PSU error codes.
Hot-swap the faulty PSU with a known-good unit.
Verify input power cables and upstream PDUs.
Confirm both primary and backup PSUs show normal status.

default_fix: Replace or clean the faulty fan to restore airflow.
steps: Identify affected fan from management logs or LEDs.
Power down the server if required and remove the fan tray.
Clean dust from fan blades and airflow vents.
Replace fan unit if RPM remains below threshold.
Reboot and confirm normal fan speeds.

default_fix: Reseat or replace the sensor assembly.
steps: Locate faulty sensor via management interface (IPMI or BMC).
Reseat the sensor harness on the motherboard.
Replace sensor module if error persists.
Monitor temperatures post-fix to ensure normal readings.

default_fix: Inspect fiber connections and replace bad SFP modules.
steps: Verify both ends of the fiber link are correctly seated.
Swap in a known-good SFP transceiver.
Test fiber continuity with a VFL or OTDR.
Confirm link comes up at expected speed and duplex.

default_fix: Replace faulty cables or NIC ports.
steps: Identify affected interface from switch logs.
Replace RJ45 or fiber cable with a certified cable.
Test interface with loopback or cable tester.
Verify CRC counters reset to zero.

default_fix: Stabilize physical connection and adjust spanning-tree.
steps: Check for duplex/speed mismatches (show interfaces status).
Replace suspect patch cables or patch panel ports.
Review spanning-tree config; enable BPDU guard if necessary.
Confirm port remains up without flapping.

default_fix: Replace failed drive and rebuild the array.
steps: Identify failed disk via RAID controller logs.
Hot-swap the failed disk with a compatible replacement.
Monitor rebuild progress in RAID management tool.
Verify array status returns to optimal upon completion.

default_fix: Replace the failing disk before data loss.
steps: Run smartctl -a /dev/sdX to view failure details.
Backup critical data from the disk immediately.
Schedule replacement of the affected disk.
Verify new disk passes SMART self-test.

default_fix: Check cabling, controllers, and replace faulty components.
steps: Review dmesg for I/O error messages and device paths.
Reseat or replace data and power cables.
Test controller ports by moving to a different slot.
Consider replacing the RAID controller if errors persist.

default_fix: Restart or update the stuck service.
steps: Identify hung process via ps or systemctl status.
Restart the service (systemctl restart <service>).
Review service logs for root-cause exceptions.
Patch or update software version if bug confirmed.

default_fix: Diagnose logs and test hardware reliability.
steps: Examine crash dump via kdump or crash.
Check for recent kernel or driver updates.
Run memtest and disk diagnostics for hardware issues.
Revert or update problematic kernel modules.
